# Sample Coordinates for MapQuest Pro

## London Area Route Example
This sample creates a route around central London landmarks:

```
51.501844,-0.140591/51.507790,-0.127911/51.511396,-0.124350/51.515411,-0.124831/51.518603,-0.130259/51.517915,-0.134668/51.515458,-0.141813/51.516653,-0.144913/51.517668,-0.149365/51.516927,-0.153066/51.515271,-0.156445/51.513381,-0.158022/51.507132,-0.151771
```

## New York City Example
Route through Manhattan landmarks:

```
40.748817,-73.985428/40.761433,-73.979681/40.775003,-73.968370/40.783060,-73.971249/40.789722,-73.976563/40.794851,-73.971767/40.796843,-73.949318/40.783115,-73.964844/40.767444,-73.981934
```

## Small Test Area (Park Route)
Simple rectangular route for testing:

```
40.783060,-73.971249/40.783060,-73.965000/40.786000,-73.965000/40.786000,-73.971249
```

## How to Use These Coordinates

1. Open MapQuest Pro
2. Click "üì• Import Coords" 
3. Switch to "Bulk Import" tab
4. Copy and paste any coordinate string above
5. Enter a shape name (e.g., "London Tour", "Manhattan Route")
6. Click "üì• Import Points"

## Coordinate Format Rules

- **Separator**: Use forward slash (/) between coordinate pairs
- **Format**: latitude,longitude (no spaces around comma)
- **Precision**: Up to 6 decimal places recommended
- **Range**: Latitude -90 to +90, Longitude -180 to +180

## Creating Your Own Coordinates

1. **From Google Maps**: Right-click any location ‚Üí "What's here?" ‚Üí copy coordinates
2. **From GPS Device**: Export waypoints in decimal degree format
3. **From Other Maps**: Most mapping services provide lat/lng coordinates
4. **Manual Entry**: Use "üìç Add Coords" for individual points

## Tips for Best Results

- Start with 4-8 points for initial testing
- Use landmarks or notable locations for easier identification  
- Keep routes within reasonable geographic areas for best map display
- Test with simple shapes before creating complex routes
